CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant is a medical practitioner whose contract with ORG ) was terminated by the latter on DATE . Subsequently the applicant was practising without a contract with ORG and is meanwhile retired . He complains CARDINAL sets of proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against ORG . He claimed that the defendant had to pay an additional amount of CARDINAL NORP schillings ( ORG ) for doctor ’s fees .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Paritätische Schiedskommission ) dismissed the applicant ’s claim . The applicant appealed against this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Landesberufungskommission ) dismissed the appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG . He alleged , inter alia , that the general agreement between ORG ( Hauptverband der PERSON ) and ORG ( PERSON ) on which his doctor ’s fees were based violated his constitutional right to non - discrimination ( ORG ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE he amended his complaint and alleged that ORG was no independent and impartial tribunal within the meaning of LAW by virtue of its composition .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the complaint . It did not accept that ORG decision had violated the applicant ’s constitutional rights . As regards the composition of ORG , ORG noted that the applicant ’s complaint had been lodged out of the statutory DATE time - limit . However , referring to its constant case - law , it found that the applicant ’s constitutional rights were not violated .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against ORG . He claimed that it had to pay some ORG CARDINAL ( QUANTITY ) as the doctor ’s fees provided for in the general agreement between ORG and ORG were far too low and , therefore , his contract with ORG was null and void .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant made a request for transfer of jurisdiction ( Devolutionsantrag ) as ORG failed to decide within the statutory DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , after having held a hearing , dismissed the applicant ’s claim .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG . He alleged that the contract between ORG and ORG on which his doctor ’s fees were based violated his constitutional right to non - discrimination . Further , he complained that ORG was no independent and impartial tribunal within the meaning of LAW by virtue of its composition and submitted that ORG had provided CARDINAL deputy directors of ORG as assessors .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the complaint . Referring to its constant case law , ORG found that ORG in general may be considered as an independent and impartial tribunal because of the term of office of the members and because members were not bound by any instructions . Further it found that ...

“ It is true that the assessors of ORG are representatives of CARDINAL conflicting spheres of interest . However , these members are not bound by instructions from the sending organisation ... and they are by no means spokespersons of these organisations . Their task is rather to bring their experience to bear in the proceedings . ... A violation of the required impartiality could , thus , ... be due to specific circumstances in the individual case resulting , for example from an official or organisational dependence of the appointed member of ORG . ...

Such official or organisational dependence does , however , in ORG view , not arise from the mere fact that the parties of the general agreement provide the assessors of ORG . ... In view of the legally guaranteed freedom from instructions of the members of ORG , a constellation affecting the appearance of independence and impartiality could - also in the light of the case PERSON v. GPE ( cited above ) - only exist if the appointed assessors had been involved in the preparation of the general agreement or if there were other specific reasons raising legitimate doubts about their independence and impartiality in determining certain legal matters . ... ”
CARDINAL . In conclusion , ORG found no indication that the members of ORG lacked independence or impartiality .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to Sections CARDINAL ff . of LAW ( Allgemeines Sozialversicherungsgesetz ) ORG ( Hauptverband der PERSON ) on behalf of ORG ) concludes with the respective ORG a general agreement ( Gesamtvertrag ) . ORG concerned has to consent to the general agreement which is the basis of individual contracts ( ORG ) between the respective ORG and medical practitioners . It regulates , inter alia , the doctor ’s fees for medical treatments effected by practitioners under contract .
CARDINAL . The Social Insurance Act , in the version in force at the material time , provided as follows :

" CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) In order to arbitrate and give a decision on disputes of a legal or factual nature arising in connection with an individual contract , a ORG shall be established in each Land ...
( CARDINAL ) ORG shall consist of CARDINAL members , CARDINAL of whom shall be appointed by ORG and CARDINAL by ORG , which is party to the individual contract . ...
( CARDINAL ) An appeal can be lodged with ORG against a decision given by ORG . ....

CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) For each Land , a permanent ORG shall be established . It shall consist of a professional judge as Chairman and of CARDINAL assessors . The Chairman shall be appointed by the Federal Minister of ORG . The Chairman must be a judge who , at the time of his appointment , is working at a court trying cases under labour and social insurance legislation . ORG and ORG each provide CARDINAL assessors . "

CARDINAL . The non - judicial members of ORG are appointed for a renewable period of DATE and not subject to the hierarchical authority of the bodies which sent them ( LAW of LAW ) . They may only be recalled , if they do not anymore fulfil the professional requirements to be appointed or if they violate or neglect their official duties . Moreover , they may be recalled upon request of the sending organisation for important personal reasons by the Federal Minister of ORG .
CARDINAL . Decisions of ORG are excluded from the competence of ORG ( Verwaltungsgerichtshof ) by LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE an amendment of ORG , modifying the manner of appointment of the assessors , entered into force . The amended version of LAW , in so far as relevant , provides as follows :

“ ... The Federal Minister of ORG shall appoint CARDINAL assessors upon proposal of ORG respectively and CARDINAL upon proposal of ORG Representatives and employees of ORG and members and employees of ORG who are parties to the general agreement on which the individual contract subject to the dispute is based , must not be assessors in the respective proceedings . ”
